intro: Dombeya vohemarensis, commonly known as the Madagascar dombeya, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, while its bark is smooth and pale. Dombeya vohemarensis is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of Madagascar and thrives in well-drained soils.
